alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Morris; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of northwestern Franklin, northeastern Morris, south central Douglas, southern Osage, north central Coffey and northern Lyon Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 547 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds along a line extending from Dwight to 3 miles north of Bushong to near Osage City to near Lone Star. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baldwin City, Council Grove, Lyndon, Centropolis, Lebo, Pomona, Quenemo, Melvern, Dwight, Reading, Allen, Admire, Olivet, Pleasant Grove, Bushong, Dunlap, Beto Junction, Pomona Lake, Globe and Council Grove Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 148 and 161. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 133 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Morris; Osage
